    Birthday Top 10

    “Either foe or friend we are all equal in the end except for the symbols we leave behind.”
    My year 50.

    1. Reading Fahrenheit 451, the same book assigned to my daughter’s summer reading.
      Ray Bradbury
    2. Better understanding how we got where we are politically. Hillbilly Elegy: A Memoir of a Family and Culture in Crisis
      J.D. Vance
    3. Finding a millenium band that kept me interested.
    4. Sharing this song that was shared with me.
      Charles Bradley- Why is it So Hard
    5. Experiencing the best dessert I have ever had.
    6. Discovering fasting works for me.
      Eat, Fast, Live Longer
    7. Making better food and using my sous-vide whenever possible.
    8. Running my 1st Marathon.
    9. Finally finishing MS in Data Science at Rutgers!
    10. Coping without my mom.
